title: LittleBits CEO Aims to Encourage Girls to Pursue STEM Careers
text: Ayah Bdeir, founder and chief executive officer at littleBits Electronics Inc., discusses a collaboration with Walt Disney Co.

title: The Billion-Dollar Startup Helping Companies Manage Customer Data
text: Peter Reinhardt, chief executive officer of Segment Inc., discusses the startup's rapid growth and the fight for data privacy with Bloomberg's Anne VanderMey and Emily Chang on "Bloomberg Technology.

title: Lazareth's transforming flying motorcycle can hover
text: The La Moto Volante from French company Lazareth demonstrated its first stable hover. NASA's helicopter that will fly on Mars has passed its flight tests.

title: Bitcoin Is Catching On Fast Outside of U.S., BitPay's Singh Says
text: Apr.02 -- A surge in Bitcoin sent the world’s most popular cryptocurrency to the highest level since November. Sonny Singh, BitPay Inc.

title: Startups Hawk Zoloft and Beta-Blockers for Off-Label Use
text: A new breed of online health-care startups is testing the boundaries of medical marketing, advertising prescription drugs for unapproved uses to college students with stage fright and men seeking to improve their sexual performance. Bloomberg's Kristen V.

title: 'Slack direct listing is a sign of cash in the bank,' says Dave Maney
text: Deke Digital CEO Dave Maney discusses  why Slack, the workplace messaging platform, is choosing to direct list on the New York Stock Exchange.

title: Andreessen Horowitz will no longer be a venture capital firm, opting to become an investment advisor
text: Venture capital firm Andreessen Horowitz filed to become a registered investment advisor so that it can have more flexibility.

title: How Peakon Uses Tech to Boost Retention Rates
text: Kasper Hulthin, Peakon co-founder, discusses the company's business model and technology in the workplace with Bloomberg's Emily Chang on "Bloomberg Technology."

title: Aireon launches world's first airline surveillance system
text: Aireon CEO Don Thoma joins "Squawk Alley" to discuss his company's new airline surveillance tool. It tracks aircraft from satellites rather than through ground-based systems.

title: Pay and work opportunities rank as big factors in workplace happiness, new survey finds
text: CNBC's Jon Fortt takes a look at some results from a survey on workplace happiness as part of a partnership with CNBC and SurveyMonkey.

title: Cashin: The bulls need to make new market highs to win over bears
text: Art Cashin, UBS director of floor operations, joins "Squawk on the Street" to talk about some of the biggest factors in the market.

title: Five Ways Uber Is Preparing for Its IPO
text: CEO Dara Khosrowshahi says Uber is on track to go public later this year, a move that could make it the biggest IPO of 2019.  WSJ’s Jason Bellini breaks down five ways Uber is preparing itself for its market debut.

title: Markets predicting no recession in 2019?
text: MacroMavens President Stephanie Pomboy on the outlook for the U.S. economy and how investors should handle the current market and economic environment.

title: Recreational marijuana use will eventually be legalized, cannabis company CEO says
text: Acreage Holdings CEO Kevin Murphy joins "Squawk Box" to discuss where the United States stands in the stage of transitioning toward legalizing recreational marijuana use.

title: Stocks Face Possible Challenges From Rising Bonds, Brexit Concerns
text: The bond market, which got beaten down Monday, looks like it is staging a bit of a rally early Tuesday.

title: The economic slowdown is here, CNBC's Steve Liesman says
text: CNBC's Steve Liesman breaks down the details of the February durable goods data and what the numbers can tell investors about the U.S. economy.

title: The Rising Risk of Stock Ownership
text: As someone who is immersed in the investment markets each day, there are things you notice anecdotally that, when you actually run the data on them, you realize you were not just imagining things.

title: From Apple To Edibles: Défoncé CEO Says He Created Brand 'For People That Enjoy And Appreciate Chocolate'
text: Last year, Jeff Siegel wrote an article for Benzinga highlighting Défoncé, “an infused chocolate-maker that’s completely raised the bar in terms of high-end edibles,” as a prime acquisition target in the cannabis industry.

title: Singapore Airlines grounds two 787-10s citing Rolls-Royce engine problem
text: Singapore Airlines Ltd said on Tuesday it had grounded two Boeing Co 787-10 jets fitted with Rolls-Royce Holdings PLC Trent 1000 TEN engines.

title: Bitcoin Price Crossed $5,000. What Is Behind The Rally?
text: Bitcoin added nearly $15 billion in a single day by breaking the level of $5,000.

title: Is The Stock Market As Confused As You Are About A Recession?
text: Being optimistic about the economy and the markets currently is far more entertaining than doom and gloom.

title: Looming downturn won't slow M&A for consumer and retail companies, but spotlight is on customers, not scale
text: Major consumer and retail companies are looking to mergers and acquisitions to strengthen their portfolios in the face of an anticipated economic slowdown by the end of 2019, a new report predicts.

title: Europe's answer to Uber expands into the electric scooter scene in Madrid
text: Bolt, formerly known as Taxify, is launching its electric kick scooter-sharing service in Madrid.
